86#endif

88#define CUSTOM_REDISPLAY_FUNC() (rl_redisplay_function != rl_redisplay)
89#define CUSTOM_INPUT_FUNC() (rl_getc_function != rl_getc)
90
91/* If the calling application sets this to a non-zero value, readline will
92 use the $LINES and $COLUMNS environment variables to set its idea of the
93 window size before interrogating the kernel. */
94int rl_prefer_env_winsize = 0;
95
96/* **************************************************************** */
97/* */
98/* Terminal and Termcap */
99/* */
100/* **************************************************************** */
101
102#ifndef __MSDOS__
103static char *term_buffer = (char *)NULL;
104static char *term_string_buffer = (char *)NULL;
105#endif /* !__MSDOS__ */
106
107static int tcap_initialized;
108
109#if !defined (__linux__) && !defined (NCURSES_VERSION)
110# if defined (__EMX__) || defined (NEED_EXTERN_PC)
111extern
112# endif /* __EMX__ || NEED_EXTERN_PC */
113char PC, *BC, *UP;
114#endif /* !__linux__ && !NCURSES_VERSION */
115
116/* Some strings to control terminal actions. These are output by tputs (). */
117char *_rl_term_clreol;
118char *_rl_term_clrpag;
119char *_rl_term_cr;
120char *_rl_term_backspace;
121char *_rl_term_goto;
122char *_rl_term_pc;
123
124/* Non-zero if we determine that the terminal can do character insertion. */
125int _rl_terminal_can_insert = 0;
126
127/* How to insert characters. */
128char *_rl_term_im;
129char *_rl_term_ei;
130char *_rl_term_ic;
131char *_rl_term_ip;
132char *_rl_term_IC;
133
134/* How to delete characters. */
135char *_rl_term_dc;
136char *_rl_term_DC;
137
138char *_rl_term_forward_char;
139
140/* How to go up a line. */
141char *_rl_term_up;
142
143/* A visible bell; char if the terminal can be made to flash the screen. */
144static char *_rl_visible_bell;
145
146/* Non-zero means the terminal can auto-wrap lines. */
147int _rl_term_autowrap = -1;
148
149/* Non-zero means that this terminal has a meta key. */
150static int term_has_meta;
151
152/* The sequences to write to turn on and off the meta key, if this
153 terminal has one. */
154static char *_rl_term_mm;
155static char *_rl_term_mo;
156
157/* The key sequences output by the arrow keys, if this terminal has any. */
158static char *_rl_term_ku;
159static char *_rl_term_kd;
160static char *_rl_term_kr;
161static char *_rl_term_kl;
162
163/* How to initialize and reset the arrow keys, if this terminal has any. */
164static char *_rl_term_ks;
165static char *_rl_term_ke;
166
167/* The key sequences sent by the Home and End keys, if any. */
168static char *_rl_term_kh;
169static char *_rl_term_kH;
170static char *_rl_term_at7; /* @7 */
171
172/* Delete key */
173static char *_rl_term_kD;
174
175/* Insert key */
176static char *_rl_term_kI;
177
178/* Cursor control */
179static char *_rl_term_vs; /* very visible */
180static char *_rl_term_ve; /* normal */
181
182static void bind_termcap_arrow_keys PARAMS((Keymap));
183
184/* Variables that hold the screen dimensions, used by the display code. */
185int _rl_screenwidth, _rl_screenheight, _rl_screenchars;
186
187/* Non-zero means the user wants to enable the keypad. */
188int _rl_enable_keypad;
189
190/* Non-zero means the user wants to enable a meta key. */
191int _rl_enable_meta = 1;
192
193#if defined (__EMX__)
194static void
195_emx_get_screensize (swp, shp)
196 int *swp, *shp;
197{
198 int sz[2];
199
200 _scrsize (sz);
201
202 if (swp)
203 *swp = sz[0];
204 if (shp)
205 *shp = sz[1];
206}
207#endif
208
209#if defined (__MINGW32__)
210static void
211_win_get_screensize (swp, shp)
212 int *swp, *shp;
213{
214 HANDLE hConOut;
215 CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO scr;
216
217 hConOut = GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
218 if (hConOut != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
219 {
220 if (GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (hConOut, &scr))
221 {
222 *swp = scr.dwSize.X;
223 *shp = scr.srWindow.Bottom - scr.srWindow.Top + 1;
224 }
225 }
226}
227#endif
228
229/* Get readline's idea of the screen size. TTY is a file descriptor open
230 to the terminal. If IGNORE_ENV is true, we do not pay attention to the
231 values of $LINES and $COLUMNS. The tests for TERM_STRING_BUFFER being
232 non-null serve to check whether or not we have initialized termcap. */
233void
234_rl_get_screen_size (tty, ignore_env)
235 int tty, ignore_env;
236{
237 char *ss;
238#if defined (TIOCGWINSZ)
239 struct winsize window_size;
240#endif /* TIOCGWINSZ */
241 int wr, wc;
242
243 wr = wc = -1;
244#if defined (TIOCGWINSZ)
245 if (ioctl (tty, TIOCGWINSZ, &window_size) == 0)
246 {
247 wc = (int) window_size.ws_col;
248 wr = (int) window_size.ws_row;
249 }
250#endif /* TIOCGWINSZ */
251
252#if defined (__EMX__)
253 _emx_get_screensize (&wc, &wr);
254#elif defined (__MINGW32__)
255 _win_get_screensize (&wc, &wr);
256#endif
257
258 if (ignore_env || rl_prefer_env_winsize == 0)
259 {
260 _rl_screenwidth = wc;
261 _rl_screenheight = wr;
262 }
263 else
264 _rl_screenwidth = _rl_screenheight = -1;
265
266 /* Environment variable COLUMNS overrides setting of "co" if IGNORE_ENV
267 is unset. If we prefer the environment, check it first before
268 assigning the value returned by the kernel. */
269 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 0)
270 {
271 if (ignore_env == 0 && (ss = sh_get_env_value ("COLUMNS")))
272 _rl_screenwidth = atoi (ss);
273
274 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 0)
275 _rl_screenwidth = wc;
276
277#if defined (__DJGPP__)
278 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 0)
279 _rl_screenwidth = ScreenCols ();
280#else
281 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 0 && term_string_buffer)
282 _rl_screenwidth = tgetnum ("co");
283#endif
284 }
285
286 /* Environment variable LINES overrides setting of "li" if IGNORE_ENV
287 is unset. */
288 if (_rl_screenheight <= 0)
289 {
290 if (ignore_env == 0 && (ss = sh_get_env_value ("LINES")))
291 _rl_screenheight = atoi (ss);
292
293 if (_rl_screenheight <= 0)
294 _rl_screenheight = wr;
295
296#if defined (__DJGPP__)
297 if (_rl_screenheight <= 0)
298 _rl_screenheight = ScreenRows ();
299#else
300 if (_rl_screenheight <= 0 && term_string_buffer)
301 _rl_screenheight = tgetnum ("li");
302#endif
303 }
304
305 /* If all else fails, default to 80x24 terminal. */
306 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 1)
307 _rl_screenwidth = 80;
308
309 if (_rl_screenheight <= 0)
310 _rl_screenheight = 24;
311
312 /* If we're being compiled as part of bash, set the environment
313 variables $LINES and $COLUMNS to new values. Otherwise, just
314 do a pair of putenv () or setenv () calls. */
315 sh_set_lines_and_columns (_rl_screenheight, _rl_screenwidth);
316
317 if (_rl_term_autowrap == 0)
318 _rl_screenwidth--;
319
320 _rl_screenchars = _rl_screenwidth * _rl_screenheight;
321}
322
323void
324_rl_set_screen_size (rows, cols)
325 int rows, cols;
326{
327 if (_rl_term_autowrap == -1)
328 _rl_init_terminal_io (rl_terminal_name);
329
330 if (rows > 0)
331 _rl_screenheight = rows;
332 if (cols > 0)
333 {
334 _rl_screenwidth = cols;
335 if (_rl_term_autowrap == 0)
336 _rl_screenwidth--;
337 }
338
339 if (rows > 0 || cols > 0)
340 _rl_screenchars = _rl_screenwidth * _rl_screenheight;
341}
342
343void
344rl_set_screen_size (rows, cols)
345 int rows, cols;
346{
347 _rl_set_screen_size (rows, cols);
348}
349
350void
351rl_get_screen_size (rows, cols)
352 int *rows, *cols;
353{
354 if (rows)
355 *rows = _rl_screenheight;
356 if (cols)
357 *cols = _rl_screenwidth;
358}
359
360void
361rl_reset_screen_size ()
362{
363 _rl_get_screen_size (fileno (rl_instream), 0);
364}
365
366void
367rl_resize_terminal ()
368{
369 _rl_get_screen_size (fileno (rl_instream), 1);
370 if (_rl_echoing_p)
371 {
372 if (CUSTOM_REDISPLAY_FUNC ())
373 rl_forced_update_display ();
374 else if (RL_ISSTATE(RL_STATE_REDISPLAYING) == 0)
375 _rl_redisplay_after_sigwinch ();
376 }
377}
378
379struct _tc_string {
380 const char * const tc_var;
381 char **tc_value;
382};
383
384/* This should be kept sorted, just in case we decide to change the
385 search algorithm to something smarter. */
386static const struct _tc_string tc_strings[] =
387{
388 { "@7", &_rl_term_at7 },
389 { "DC", &_rl_term_DC },
390 { "IC", &_rl_term_IC },
391 { "ce", &_rl_term_clreol },
392 { "cl", &_rl_term_clrpag },
393 { "cr", &_rl_term_cr },
394 { "dc", &_rl_term_dc },
395 { "ei", &_rl_term_ei },
396 { "ic", &_rl_term_ic },
397 { "im", &_rl_term_im },
398 { "kD", &_rl_term_kD }, /* delete */
399 { "kH", &_rl_term_kH }, /* home down ?? */
400 { "kI", &_rl_term_kI }, /* insert */
401 { "kd", &_rl_term_kd },
402 { "ke", &_rl_term_ke }, /* end keypad mode */
403 { "kh", &_rl_term_kh }, /* home */
404 { "kl", &_rl_term_kl },
405 { "kr", &_rl_term_kr },
406 { "ks", &_rl_term_ks }, /* start keypad mode */
407 { "ku", &_rl_term_ku },
408 { "le", &_rl_term_backspace },
409 { "mm", &_rl_term_mm },
410 { "mo", &_rl_term_mo },
411 { "nd", &_rl_term_forward_char },
412 { "pc", &_rl_term_pc },
413 { "up", &_rl_term_up },
414 { "vb", &_rl_visible_bell },
415 { "vs", &_rl_term_vs },
416 { "ve", &_rl_term_ve },
417};
418
419#define NUM_TC_STRINGS (sizeof (tc_strings) / sizeof (struct _tc_string))
420
421/* Read the desired terminal capability strings into BP. The capabilities
422 are described in the TC_STRINGS table. */
423static void
424get_term_capabilities (bp)
425 char **bp;
426{
427#if !defined (__DJGPP__) /* XXX - doesn't DJGPP have a termcap library? */
428 register int i;
429
430 for (i = 0; i < NUM_TC_STRINGS; i++)
431 *(tc_strings[i].tc_value) = tgetstr ((char *)tc_strings[i].tc_var, bp);
432#endif
433 tcap_initialized = 1;
434}
435
436int
437_rl_init_terminal_io (terminal_name)
438 const char *terminal_name;
439{
440 const char *term;
441 char *buffer;
442 int tty, tgetent_ret;
443
444 term = terminal_name ? terminal_name : sh_get_env_value ("TERM");
445 _rl_term_clrpag = _rl_term_cr = _rl_term_clreol = (char *)NULL;
446 tty = rl_instream ? fileno (rl_instream) : 0;
447
448 if (term == 0)
449 term = "dumb";
450
451#ifdef __MSDOS__
452 _rl_term_im = _rl_term_ei = _rl_term_ic = _rl_term_IC = (char *)NULL;
453 _rl_term_up = _rl_term_dc = _rl_term_DC = _rl_visible_bell = (char *)NULL;
454 _rl_term_ku = _rl_term_kd = _rl_term_kl = _rl_term_kr = (char *)NULL;
455 _rl_term_mm = _rl_term_mo = (char *)NULL;
456 _rl_terminal_can_insert = term_has_meta = _rl_term_autowrap = 0;
457 _rl_term_cr = "\r";
458 _rl_term_clreol = _rl_term_clrpag = _rl_term_backspace = (char *)NULL;
459 _rl_term_goto = _rl_term_pc = _rl_term_ip = (char *)NULL;
460 _rl_term_ks = _rl_term_ke =_rl_term_vs = _rl_term_ve = (char *)NULL;
461 _rl_term_kh = _rl_term_kH = _rl_term_at7 = _rl_term_kI = (char *)NULL;
462#if defined(HACK_TERMCAP_MOTION)
463 _rl_term_forward_char = (char *)NULL;
464#endif
465
466 _rl_get_screen_size (tty, 0);
467#else /* !__MSDOS__ */
468 /* I've separated this out for later work on not calling tgetent at all
469 if the calling application has supplied a custom redisplay function,
470 (and possibly if the application has supplied a custom input function). */
471 if (CUSTOM_REDISPLAY_FUNC())
472 {
473 tgetent_ret = -1;
474 }
475 else
476 {
477 if (term_string_buffer == 0)
478 term_string_buffer = (char *)xmalloc(2032);
479
480 if (term_buffer == 0)
481 term_buffer = (char *)xmalloc(4080);
482
483 buffer = term_string_buffer;
484
485 tgetent_ret = tgetent (term_buffer, term);
486 }
487
488 if (tgetent_ret <= 0)
489 {
490 FREE (term_string_buffer);
491 FREE (term_buffer);
492 buffer = term_buffer = term_string_buffer = (char *)NULL;
493
494 _rl_term_autowrap = 0; /* used by _rl_get_screen_size */
495
496 /* Allow calling application to set default height and width, using
497 rl_set_screen_size */
498 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 0 || _rl_screenheight <= 0)
499 {
500#if defined (__EMX__)
501 _emx_get_screensize (&_rl_screenwidth, &_rl_screenheight);
502 _rl_screenwidth--;
503#else /* !__EMX__ */
504 _rl_get_screen_size (tty, 0);
505#endif /* !__EMX__ */
506 }
507
508 /* Defaults. */
509 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 0 || _rl_screenheight <= 0)
510 {
511 _rl_screenwidth = 79;
512 _rl_screenheight = 24;
513 }
514
515 /* Everything below here is used by the redisplay code (tputs). */
516 _rl_screenchars = _rl_screenwidth * _rl_screenheight;
517 _rl_term_cr = "\r";
518 _rl_term_im = _rl_term_ei = _rl_term_ic = _rl_term_IC = (char *)NULL;
519 _rl_term_up = _rl_term_dc = _rl_term_DC = _rl_visible_bell = (char *)NULL;
520 _rl_term_ku = _rl_term_kd = _rl_term_kl = _rl_term_kr = (char *)NULL;
521 _rl_term_kh = _rl_term_kH = _rl_term_kI = _rl_term_kD = (char *)NULL;
522 _rl_term_ks = _rl_term_ke = _rl_term_at7 = (char *)NULL;
523 _rl_term_mm = _rl_term_mo = (char *)NULL;
524 _rl_term_ve = _rl_term_vs = (char *)NULL;
525 _rl_term_forward_char = (char *)NULL;
526 _rl_terminal_can_insert = term_has_meta = 0;
527
528 /* Reasonable defaults for tgoto(). Readline currently only uses
529 tgoto if _rl_term_IC or _rl_term_DC is defined, but just in case we
530 change that later... */
531 PC = '\0';
532 BC = _rl_term_backspace = "\b";
533 UP = _rl_term_up;
534
535 return 0;
536 }
537
538 get_term_capabilities (&buffer);
539
540 /* Set up the variables that the termcap library expects the application
541 to provide. */
542 PC = _rl_term_pc ? *_rl_term_pc : 0;
543 BC = _rl_term_backspace;
544 UP = _rl_term_up;
545
546 if (!_rl_term_cr)
547 _rl_term_cr = "\r";
548
549 _rl_term_autowrap = tgetflag ("am") && tgetflag ("xn");
550
551 /* Allow calling application to set default height and width, using
552 rl_set_screen_size */
553 if (_rl_screenwidth <= 0 || _rl_screenheight <= 0)
554 _rl_get_screen_size (tty, 0);
555
556 /* "An application program can assume that the terminal can do
557 character insertion if *any one of* the capabilities `IC',
558 `im', `ic' or `ip' is provided." But we can't do anything if
559 only `ip' is provided, so... */
560 _rl_terminal_can_insert = (_rl_term_IC || _rl_term_im || _rl_term_ic);
561
562 /* Check to see if this terminal has a meta key and clear the capability
563 variables if there is none. */
564 term_has_meta = tgetflag ("km") != 0;
565 if (term_has_meta == 0)
566 _rl_term_mm = _rl_term_mo = (char *)NULL;
567
568#endif /* !__MSDOS__ */
569
570 /* Attempt to find and bind the arrow keys. Do not override already
571 bound keys in an overzealous attempt, however. */
572
573 bind_termcap_arrow_keys (emacs_standard_keymap);
574
575#if defined (VI_MODE)
576 bind_termcap_arrow_keys (vi_movement_keymap);
577 bind_termcap_arrow_keys (vi_insertion_keymap);
578#endif /* VI_MODE */
579
580 return 0;
581}
582
583/* Bind the arrow key sequences from the termcap description in MAP. */
584static void
585bind_termcap_arrow_keys (map)
586 Keymap map;
587{
588 Keymap xkeymap;
589
590 xkeymap = _rl_keymap;
591 _rl_keymap = map;
592
593 rl_bind_keyseq_if_unbound (_rl_term_ku, rl_get_previous_history);
594 rl_bind_keyseq_if_unbound (_rl_term_kd, rl_get_next_history);
595 rl_bind_keyseq_if_unbound (_rl_term_kr, rl_forward_char);
596 rl_bind_keyseq_if_unbound (_rl_term_kl, rl_backward_char);
597
598 rl_bind_keyseq_if_unbound (_rl_term_kh, rl_beg_of_line); /* Home */
599 rl_bind_keyseq_if_unbound (_rl_term_at7, rl_end_of_line); /* End */
600
601 rl_bind_keyseq_if_unbound (_rl_term_kD, rl_delete);
602
603 _rl_keymap = xkeymap;
604}
605
606char *
607rl_get_termcap (cap)
608 const char *cap;
609{
610 register int i;
611
612 if (tcap_initialized == 0)
613 return ((char *)NULL);
614 for (i = 0; i < NUM_TC_STRINGS; i++)
615 {
616 if (tc_strings[i].tc_var[0] == cap[0] && strcmp (tc_strings[i].tc_var, cap) == 0)
617 return *(tc_strings[i].tc_value);
618 }
619 return ((char *)NULL);
620}
621
622/* Re-initialize the terminal considering that the TERM/TERMCAP variable
623 has changed. */
624int
625rl_reset_terminal (terminal_name)
626 const char *terminal_name;
627{
628 _rl_screenwidth = _rl_screenheight = 0;
629 _rl_init_terminal_io (terminal_name);
630 return 0;
631}
632
633/* A function for the use of tputs () */
634#ifdef _MINIX
635void
636_rl_output_character_function (c)
637 int c;
638{
639 putc (c, _rl_out_stream);
640}
641#else /* !_MINIX */
642int
643_rl_output_character_function (c)
644 int c;
645{
646 return putc (c, _rl_out_stream);
647}
648#endif /* !_MINIX */
649
650/* Write COUNT characters from STRING to the output stream. */
651void
652_rl_output_some_chars (string, count)
653 const char *string;
654 int count;
655{
656 fwrite (string, 1, count, _rl_out_stream);
657}
658
659/* Move the cursor back. */
660int
661_rl_backspace (count)
662 int count;
663{
664 register int i;
665
666#ifndef __MSDOS__
667 if (_rl_term_backspace)
668 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
669 tputs (_rl_term_backspace, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
670 else
671#endif
672 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
673 putc ('\b', _rl_out_stream);
674 return 0;
675}
676
677/* Move to the start of the next line. */
678int
679rl_crlf ()
680{
681#if defined (NEW_TTY_DRIVER) || defined (__MINT__)
682 if (_rl_term_cr)
683 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
684#endif /* NEW_TTY_DRIVER || __MINT__ */
685 putc ('\n', _rl_out_stream);
686 return 0;
687}
688
689/* Ring the terminal bell. */
690int
691rl_ding ()
692{
693 if (_rl_echoing_p)
694 {
695 switch (_rl_bell_preference)
696 {
697 case NO_BELL:
698 default:
699 break;
700 case VISIBLE_BELL:
701#ifdef __MSDOS__
702 ScreenVisualBell ();
703 break;
704#else
705 if (_rl_visible_bell)
706 {
707 tputs (_rl_visible_bell, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
708 break;
709 }
710 /* FALLTHROUGH */
711#endif
712 case AUDIBLE_BELL:
713 fprintf (stderr, "\007");
714 fflush (stderr);
715 break;
716 }
717 return (0);
718 }
719 return (-1);
720}
721
722/* **************************************************************** */
723/* */
724/* Controlling the Meta Key and Keypad */
725/* */
726/* **************************************************************** */
727
728void
729_rl_enable_meta_key ()
730{
731#if !defined (__DJGPP__)
732 if (term_has_meta && _rl_term_mm)
733 tputs (_rl_term_mm, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
734#endif
735}
736
737void
738_rl_control_keypad (on)
739 int on;
740{
741#if !defined (__DJGPP__)
742 if (on && _rl_term_ks)
743 tputs (_rl_term_ks, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
744 else if (!on && _rl_term_ke)
745 tputs (_rl_term_ke, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
746#endif
747}
748
749/* **************************************************************** */
750/* */
751/* Controlling the Cursor */
752/* */
753/* **************************************************************** */
754
755/* Set the cursor appropriately depending on IM, which is one of the
756 insert modes (insert or overwrite). Insert mode gets the normal
757 cursor. Overwrite mode gets a very visible cursor. Only does
758 anything if we have both capabilities. */
759void
760_rl_set_cursor (im, force)
761 int im, force;
762{
763#ifndef __MSDOS__
764 if (_rl_term_ve && _rl_term_vs)
765 {
766 if (force || im != rl_insert_mode)
767 {
768 if (im == RL_IM_OVERWRITE)
769 tputs (_rl_term_vs, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
770 else
771 tputs (_rl_term_ve, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
772 }
773 }
774#endif
775}
